        <li id="cite_note-424"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-424">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBiswas2016" class="citation news cs1">Biswas, Soutik (29 September 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-37481054">"What divorce and separation tell us about modern India"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=What+divorce+and+separation+tell+us+about+modern+India&amp;rft.date=2016-09-29&amp;rft.aulast=Biswas&amp;rft.aufirst=Soutik&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fworld-asia-india-37481054&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECullen-Dupont200996-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECullen-Dupont200996_425-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCullen-Dupont2009">Cullen-Dupont 2009</a>, p.&nbsp;96.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-The_Hindu_November_17_2019c-426"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-The_Hindu_November_17_2019c_426-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKapoorShamika2014" class="citation news cs1">Kapoor, Mudit; Shamika, Ravi (10 February 2014). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.thehindu.com/opinion/lead/indias-missing-women/article5670801.ece">"India's missing women"</a>. <i>The Hindu</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Hindu&amp;rft.atitle=India%27s+missing+women&amp;rft.date=2014-02-10&amp;rft.aulast=Kapoor&amp;rft.aufirst=Mudit&amp;rft.au=Shamika%2C+Ravi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thehindu.com%2Fopinion%2Flead%2Findias-missing-women%2Farticle5670801.ece&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "In the last 50 years of Indian democracy, the absolute number of missing women has increased fourfold from 15 million to 68 million. This is not merely a reflection of the growth in the overall population, but, rather, of the fact that this dangerous trend has worsened with time. As a percentage of the female electorate, missing women have gone up significantly — from 13 per cent to approximately 20 per cent</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-The_Guardian_November_17_2019c-427"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-The_Guardian_November_17_2019c_427-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFThe_Associated_Press2018" class="citation web cs1">The Associated Press (30 January 2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/30/more-than-63-million-women-missing-in-india-statistics-show">"More than 63 million women 'missing' in India, statistics show"</a>. <i>The Guardian</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Guardian&amp;rft.atitle=More+than+63+million+women+%27missing%27+in+India%2C+statistics+show&amp;rft.date=2018-01-30&amp;rft.au=The+Associated+Press&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2F2018%2Fjan%2F30%2Fmore-than-63-million-women-missing-in-india-statistics-show&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "More than 63 million women are “missing” statistically across India, and more than 21 million girls are unwanted by their families, government officials say. The skewed ratio of men to women is largely the result of sex-selective abortions, and better nutrition and medical care for boys, according to the government’s annual economic survey, which was released on Monday. In addition, the survey found that “families where a son is born are more likely to stop having children than families where a girl is born”.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-Foreign_Policy_November_17_2019c-428"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Foreign_Policy_November_17_2019c_428-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFTrivedi" class="citation web cs1">Trivedi, Ira. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://foreignpolicy.com/2019/08/15/a-generation-of-girls-is-missing-in-india/">"A Generation of Girls Is Missing in India – Sex-selective abortion fuels a cycle of patriarchy and abuse"</a>. <i>Foregin Policy</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 November</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Foregin+Policy&amp;rft.atitle=A+Generation+of+Girls+Is+Missing+in+India+%E2%80%93+Sex-selective+abortion+fuels+a+cycle+of+patriarchy+and+abuse.&amp;rft.aulast=Trivedi&amp;rft.aufirst=Ira&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fforeignpolicy.com%2F2019%2F08%2F15%2Fa-generation-of-girls-is-missing-in-india%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "Although it has been illegal nationwide for doctors to disclose the sex of a fetus since the 1994 Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act, the ease of ordering cheap and portable ultrasound machines, especially online, has kept the practice of sex-selective abortions alive."</span> </li>

        <li id="cite_note-StevensonWaite2011-kurta-447"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-StevensonWaite2011-kurta_447-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFRoger2000" class="citation cs2">Roger, Delphine (2000), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Vr2qnK_QOuAC&amp;pg=PA1140">"The Middle East and South Asia (in Chapter: History and Culture of Food and Drink in Asia)"</a>, in Kiple, Kenneth F.; Ornelas, Kriemhild Coneè (eds.), <i>The Cambridge World History of Food</i>, <b>2</b>, Cambridge and New York: <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>, pp.&nbsp;1140–1150, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-40215-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-40215-6"><bdi>978-0-521-40215-6</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+Middle+East+and+South+Asia+%28in+Chapter%3A+History+and+Culture+of+Food+and+Drink+in+Asia%29&amp;rft.btitle=The+Cambridge+World+History+of+Food&amp;rft.place=Cambridge+and+New+York&amp;rft.pages=1140-1150&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-40215-6&amp;rft.aulast=Roger&amp;rft.aufirst=Delphine&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DVr2qnK_QOuAC%26pg%3DPA1140&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-Davidson2014-p409-461"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_461-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_461-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Davidson2014-p409_461-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-SrinivasanJermyn2001-481"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-SrinivasanJermyn2001_481-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFSrinivasanJermynLek2001" class="citation cs2">Srinivasan, Radhika; Jermyn, Leslie; Lek, Hui Hui (2001), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=zoVby4OJWhYC&amp;pg=PA109"><i>India</i></a>, Times Books International, p.&nbsp;109, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-981-232-184-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-981-232-184-8"><bdi>978-981-232-184-8</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India&amp;rft.pages=109&amp;rft.pub=Times+Books+International&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-981-232-184-8&amp;rft.aulast=Srinivasan&amp;rft.aufirst=Radhika&amp;rft.au=Jermyn%2C+Leslie&amp;rft.au=Lek%2C+Hui+Hui&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DzoVby4OJWhYC%26pg%3DPA109&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span> Quote: "Girls in India usually play jump rope, or hopscotch, and five stones, tossing the stones up in the air and catching them in many different ways ... the coconut-plucking contests, groundnut-eating races, ... of rural India."</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEDehejia2011-482"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEDehejia2011_482-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFDehejia2011">Dehejia 2011</a>.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-483"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-483">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://nation.com.pk/02-Jan-2010/basketball-team-named-for-11th-south-asian-games">"Basketball team named for 11th South Asian Games"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Nation_(Pakistan)" title="The Nation (Pakistan)">The Nation (Pakistan)</a></i>.        </ol>
      </div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Bibliography">Bibliography</span></h2>

      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011217839">

        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFEncyclopædia_Britannica" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/266465/Hindustan">"Hindustan"</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopædia Britannica">Encyclopædia Britannica</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 July</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Hindustan&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Britannica&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.britannica.com%2FEBchecked%2Ftopic%2F266465%2FHindustan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMinistry_of_Law_and_Justice_2008" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140909230437/http://lawmin.nic.in/coi/coiason29july08.pdf"><i>Constitution of India</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>, <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Law_and_Justice_(India)" title="Ministry of Law and Justice (India)">Ministry of Law and Justice</a>, 29 July 2008, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://lawmin.nic.in/coi/coiason29july08.pdf">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 9 September 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 March</span> 2012</span>, <q>Article 1(1): "India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States."</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Constitution+of+India&amp;rft.pub=Ministry+of+Law+and+Justice&amp;rft.date=2008-07-29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flawmin.nic.in%2Fcoi%2Fcoiason29july08.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

      <p><b>History</b> </p>

         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAsherTalbot2008" class="citation cs2">Asher, C.       <p><b>Geography</b> </p> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011217839">
      <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 33em"> 
       <ul>
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAliAitchison2005" class="citation cs2">Ali, J. R.; Aitchison, J. C. (2005), "Greater India", <i><a href="/wiki/Earth-Science_Reviews" title="Earth-Science Reviews">Earth-Science Reviews</a></i>, <b>72</b> (3–4): 170–173, <a href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2005ESRv...72..169A">2005ESRv...72..169A</a>, <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.earscirev.2005.07.005">10.1016/j.earscirev.2005.07.005</a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Earth-Science+Reviews&amp;rft.atitle=Greater+India&amp;rft.volume=72&amp;rft.issue=3%E2%80%934&amp;rft.pages=170-173&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2Fj.earscirev.2005.07.005&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2005ESRv...72..169A&amp;rft.aulast=Ali&amp;rft.aufirst=J.+R.&amp;rft.au=Aitchison%2C+J.+C.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

      <p><b>Biodiversity</b> </p>

         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFSecretariat_of_the_Convention_on_Wetlands" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070621011113/http://www.ramsar.org/sitelist.pdf"><i>The List of Wetlands of International Importance</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>, The Secretariat of the Convention on Wetlands, 4 June 2007, p.&nbsp;18, archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ramsar.org/sitelist.pdf">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 21 June 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 June</span> 2007</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+List+of+Wetlands+of+International+Importance&amp;rft.pages=18&amp;rft.pub=The+Secretariat+of+the+Convention+on+Wetlands&amp;rft.date=2007-06-04&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ramsar.org%2Fsitelist.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFTritsch2001" class="citation cs2">Tritsch, M. F. (2001), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=aNRQAAAACAAJ"><i>Wildlife of India</i></a>, London: <a href="/wiki/HarperCollins" title="HarperCollins">HarperCollins</a>, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-00-711062-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-00-711062-9"><bdi>978-0-00-711062-9</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Wildlife+of+India&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pub=HarperCollins&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-00-711062-9&amp;rft.aulast=Tritsch&amp;rft.aufirst=M.+F.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DaNRQAAAACAAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
       </ul> 
      </div> 
      <p><b>Politics</b> </p>

         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFInternational_Monetary_Fund_2011a" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2011/01/weodata/weorept.aspx?sy=2009&amp;ey=2016&amp;scsm=1&amp;ssd=1&amp;sort=country&amp;ds=.&amp;br=1&amp;c=512%2C548%2C558%2C564%2C566%2C524%2C578%2C534%2C536&amp;s=NGDPDPC&amp;grp=0&amp;a=&amp;pr.x=60&amp;pr.y=17"><i>World Economic Outlook Update</i></a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">International Monetary Fund</a>, June 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 July</span> 2011</span></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=World+Economic+Outlook+Update&amp;rft.pub=International+Monetary+Fund&amp;rft.date=2011-06&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.imf.org%2Fexternal%2Fpubs%2Fft%2Fweo%2F2011%2F01%2Fweodata%2Fweorept.aspx%3Fsy%3D2009%26ey%3D2016%26scsm%3D1%26ssd%3D1%26sort%3Dcountry%26ds%3D.%26br%3D1%26c%3D512%252C548%252C558%252C564%252C566%252C524%252C578%252C534%252C536%26s%3DNGDPDPC%26grp%3D0%26a%3D%26pr.x%3D60%26pr.y%3D17&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
       </ul> 
      </div>

      <p><b>Culture</b> </p> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011217839">
      <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 33em"> 
       <ul>
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBinmore2007" class="citation cs2">Binmore, K. G.          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFEncyclopædia_Britannica2008" class="citation cs2"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://original.britannica.com/eb/article-9071111/Tamil-literature">"Tamil Literature"</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopædia Britannica">Encyclopædia Britannica</a></i>, 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 July</span> 2011</span>, <q>Apart from literature written in classical (Indo-Aryan) Sanskrit, Tamil is the oldest literature in India. Some inscriptions on stone have been dated to the 3rd century BC, but <a href="/wiki/Tamil_literature" title="Tamil literature">Tamil literature</a> proper begins around the 1st century AD. Much early poetry was religious or epic; an exception was the secular court poetry written by members of the <i>sangam</i>, or literary academy (see Sangam literature).--&gt;</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Tamil+Literature&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Britannica&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Foriginal.britannica.com%2Feb%2Farticle-9071111%2FTamil-literature&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIndia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/26px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="26" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/39px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/51px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="410" data-file-height="430"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Special:Search/India" class="extiw" title="s:Special:Search/India">Texts</a> from Wikisource</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikibooks-logo.svg/27px-Wikibooks-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="27" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikibooks-logo.svg/41px-Wikibooks-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikibooks-logo.svg/54px-Wikibooks-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="300"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:Search/India" class="extiw" title="b:Special:Search/India">Textbooks</a> from Wikibooks</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/27px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png" decoding="async" width="27" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/41px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg/54px-Wikivoyage-Logo-v3-icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="193" data-file-height="193"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikivoyage.org/wiki/India" class="extiw" title="voy:India">Travel guide</a> from Wikivoyage</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg/27px-Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg.png" decoding="async" width="27" height="22" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg/41px-Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg/54px-Wikiversity_logo_2017.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="626" data-file-height="512"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/Special:Search/India" class="extiw" title="v:Special:Search/India">Resources</a> from Wikiversity</span></li>
       </ul>
      </div> 
      <p><b>Government</b> </p>

      </ul>

       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/india/">India</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency" title="Central Intelligence Agency">Central Intelligence Agency</a>.</li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://curlie.org/Regional/Asia/India">India</a> at <a href="/wiki/Curlie" class="mw-redirect" title="Curlie">Curlie</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090406224510/http://ucblibraries.colorado.edu/govpubs/for/british.htm">India</a> from <i>UCB Libraries GovPubs</i></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-south-asia-12557384">India</a> from the <a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a></li> 
       <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.wikivillage.in/">Indian State district block village website</a></li> 
       <li><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/16px-Gnome-globe.svg.png" decoding="async" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/24px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/32px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="48" data-file-height="48"> <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Atlas_of_India" class="extiw" title="commons:Atlas of India">Wikimedia Atlas of India</a></li> 
       <li><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Openstreetmap_logo.svg/16px-Openstreetmap_logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Openstreetmap_logo.svg/24px-Openstreetmap_logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Openstreetmap_logo.svg/32px-Openstreetmap_logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="256" data-file-height="256"> Geographic data related to <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/304716">India</a> at <a href="/wiki/OpenStreetMap" title="OpenStreetMap">OpenStreetMap</a></li>

                  <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Landforms</th>

                     <li><a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_of_India" title="List of islands of India">Islands</a></li>

                      </ul></li>

                     <li><a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Andhra_Pradesh" title="Economy of Andhra Pradesh">Andhra Pradesh</a></li>

                     <li><a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Madhya_Pradesh" title="Economy of Madhya Pradesh">Madhya Pradesh</a></li>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/List_of_BRICS_leaders" class="mw-redirect" title="List of BRICS leaders">Leaders</a></th>

                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/22px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png" decoding="async" width="22" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/33px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/43px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="504"></span> <a href="/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro" title="Jair Bolsonaro">Bolsonaro</a></li>

                <td colspan="2" class="navbox-list navbox-odd plainlist" style="width:100%;padding:0px;text-align:left; padding-left:0.3em;">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
                  <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r998391716">
                  <div class="div-col" style="column-width: 12em;"> 
                   <ul>
                    <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="640">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">Australia</a></li>

                   <li><a href="/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates" title="United Arab Emirates">United Arab Emirates</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Uzbekistan" title="Uzbekistan">Uzbekistan</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Vietnam" title="Vietnam">Vietnam</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Yemen" title="Yemen">Yemen</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="3" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px;padding: 0 0.5em;">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/File:Asia_(orthographic_projection).svg" class="image"><img alt="Asia (orthographic projection).svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/100px-Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="100" height="100" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/150px-Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/200px-Asia_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="541" data-file-height="541"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/List_of_states_with_limited_recognition" title="List of states with limited recognition">States with limited recognition</a></th>
